name: adexchangebuyer2
title: Ad Exchange Buyer API II
description: Accesses the latest features for managing Ad Exchange accounts, Real-Time Bidding configurations and auction metrics, and Marketplace programmatic deals.

parameters.name: prettyPrint
parameters.desc: Returns response with indentations and line breaks.

enum.name: json
enum.desc: Responses with Content-Type of application/json

enum.name: media
enum.desc: Media download with context-dependent Content-Type

enum.name: proto
enum.desc: Responses with Content-Type of application/x-protobuf

parameters.name: quotaUser
parameters.desc: Available to use for quota purposes for server-side applications. Can be any arbitrary string assigned to a user, but should not exceed 40 characters.

parameters.name: oauth_token
parameters.desc: OAuth 2.0 token for the current user.

parameters.name: key
parameters.desc: API key. Your API key identifies your project and provides you with API access, quota, and reports. Required unless you provide an OAuth 2.0 token.

parameters.name: fields
parameters.desc: Selector specifying which fields to include in a partial response.

enum.desc: v1 error format
v2 error format

schemas.name: ClientUserInvitation
schemas.desc:
An invitation for a new client user to get access to the Ad Exchange
Buyer UI.
All fields are required unless otherwise specified.

fields.name: invitationId
fields.desc:
The unique numerical ID of the invitation that is sent to the user.
The value of this field is ignored in create operations.

fields.name: email
fields.desc:
The email address to which the invitation is sent. Email
addresses should be unique among all client users under each sponsor
buyer.

fields.name: clientAccountId
fields.desc:
Numerical account ID of the client buyer
that the invited user is associated with.
The value of this field is ignored in create operations.

schemas.name: FilteringStats
schemas.desc:
@OutputOnly Filtering reasons for this creative during a period of a single
day (from midnight to midnight Pacific).

fields.name: date
fields.desc:
The day during which the data was collected.
The data is collected from 00:00:00 to 23:59:59 PT.
During switches from PST to PDT and back, the day may
contain 23 or 25 hours of data instead of the usual 24.

fields.name: reasons
fields.desc: The set of filtering reasons for this date.

schemas.name: Client
schemas.desc:
A client resource represents a client buyer—an agency,
a brand, or an advertiser customer of the sponsor buyer.
Users associated with the client buyer have restricted access to
the Ad Exchange Marketplace and certain other sections
of the Ad Exchange Buyer UI based on the role
granted to the client buyer.
All fields are required unless otherwise specified.

fields.name: entityType
fields.desc: The type of the client entity: `ADVERTISER`, `BRAND`, or `AGENCY`.

enum.name: ENTITY_TYPE_UNSPECIFIED
enum.desc: A placeholder for an undefined client entity type. Should not be used.

enum.name: ADVERTISER
enum.desc: An advertiser.

enum.name: BRAND
enum.desc: A brand.

enum.name: AGENCY
enum.desc: An advertising agency.

fields.name: clientName
fields.desc:
Name used to represent this client to publishers.
You may have multiple clients that map to the same entity,
but for each client the combination of `clientName` and entity
must be unique.
You can specify this field as empty.

fields.name: role
fields.desc:
The role which is assigned to the client buyer. Each role implies a set of
permissions granted to the client. Must be one of `CLIENT_DEAL_VIEWER`,
`CLIENT_DEAL_NEGOTIATOR` or `CLIENT_DEAL_APPROVER`.

enum.name: CLIENT_ROLE_UNSPECIFIED
enum.desc: A placeholder for an undefined client role.

enum.name: CLIENT_DEAL_VIEWER
enum.desc:
Users associated with this client can see publisher deal offers
in the Marketplace.
They can neither negotiate proposals nor approve deals.
If this client is visible to publishers, they can send deal proposals
to this client.

enum.name: CLIENT_DEAL_NEGOTIATOR
enum.desc:
Users associated with this client can respond to deal proposals
sent to them by publishers. They can also initiate deal proposals
of their own.

enum.name: CLIENT_DEAL_APPROVER
enum.desc:
Users associated with this client can approve eligible deals
on your behalf. Some deals may still explicitly require publisher
finalization. If this role is not selected, the sponsor buyer
will need to manually approve each of their deals.

fields.name: visibleToSeller
fields.desc: Whether the client buyer will be visible to sellers.

fields.name: entityId
fields.desc:
Numerical identifier of the client entity.
The entity can be an advertiser, a brand, or an agency.
This identifier is unique among all the entities with the same type.

A list of all known advertisers with their identifiers is available in the
[advertisers.txt](https://storage.googleapis.com/adx-rtb-dictionaries/advertisers.txt)
file.

A list of all known brands with their identifiers is available in the
[brands.txt](https://storage.googleapis.com/adx-rtb-dictionaries/brands.txt)
file.

A list of all known agencies with their identifiers is available in the
[agencies.txt](https://storage.googleapis.com/adx-rtb-dictionaries/agencies.txt)
file.

fields.name: clientAccountId
fields.desc:
The globally-unique numerical ID of the client.
The value of this field is ignored in create and update operations.

fields.name: entityName
fields.desc:
The name of the entity. This field is automatically fetched based on
the type and ID.
The value of this field is ignored in create and update operations.

fields.name: status
fields.desc: The status of the client buyer.

enum.name: CLIENT_STATUS_UNSPECIFIED
enum.desc: A placeholder for an undefined client status.

enum.name: DISABLED
enum.desc: A client that is currently disabled.

enum.name: ACTIVE
enum.desc: A client that is currently active.

schemas.name: ListDealAssociationsResponse
schemas.desc: A response for listing creative and deal associations

fields.name: associations
fields.desc: The list of associations.

fields.name: nextPageToken
fields.desc:
A token to retrieve the next page of results.
Pass this value in the
ListDealAssociationsRequest.page_token
field in the subsequent call to 'ListDealAssociation' method to retrieve
the next page of results.

schemas.name: Date
schemas.desc:
Represents a whole calendar date, e.g. date of birth. The time of day and
time zone are either specified elsewhere or are not significant. The date
is relative to the Proleptic Gregorian Calendar. The day may be 0 to
represent a year and month where the day is not significant, e.g. credit card
expiration date. The year may be 0 to represent a month and day independent
of year, e.g. anniversary date. Related types are google.type.TimeOfDay
and `google.protobuf.Timestamp`.

fields.name: month
fields.desc: Month of year. Must be from 1 to 12.

fields.name: year
fields.desc:
Year of date. Must be from 1 to 9999, or 0 if specifying a date without
a year.

fields.name: day
fields.desc:
Day of month. Must be from 1 to 31 and valid for the year and month, or 0
if specifying a year/month where the day is not significant.

schemas.name: Empty
NativeContent
schemas.desc: Native content for a creative.

fields.name: clickTrackingUrl
fields.desc: The URL to use for click tracking.

fields.name: image
fields.desc: A large image.

fields.name: advertiserName
fields.desc: The name of the advertiser or sponsor, to be displayed in the ad creative.

fields.name: storeUrl
fields.desc: The URL to the app store to purchase/download the promoted app.

fields.name: appIcon
fields.desc: The app icon, for app download ads.

fields.name: starRating
fields.desc: The app rating in the app store. Must be in the range [0-5].

fields.name: videoUrl
fields.desc: The URL to fetch a native video ad.

fields.name: clickLinkUrl
fields.desc: The URL that the browser/SDK will load when the user clicks the ad.

fields.name: logo
fields.desc: A smaller image, for the advertiser's logo.

fields.name: priceDisplayText
fields.desc: The price of the promoted app including currency info.

fields.name: headline
fields.desc: A short title for the ad.

fields.name: callToAction
fields.desc: A label for the button that the user is supposed to click.

fields.name: body
fields.desc: A long description of the ad.

schemas.name: Image
schemas.desc:
An image resource. You may provide a larger image than was requested,
so long as the aspect ratio is preserved.

fields.name: width
fields.desc: Image width in pixels.

fields.name: url
fields.desc: The URL of the image.

fields.name: height
fields.desc: Image height in pixels.

schemas.name: Reason
schemas.desc: A specific filtering status and how many times it occurred.

fields.name: status
fields.desc:
The filtering status code. Please refer to the
[creative-status-codes.txt](https://storage.googleapis.com/adx-rtb-dictionaries/creative-status-codes.txt)
file for different statuses.

fields.name: count
fields.desc:
The number of times the creative was filtered for the status. The
count is aggregated across all publishers on the exchange.

schemas.name: ServingRestriction
schemas.desc:
@OutputOnly A representation of the status of an ad in a
specific context. A context here relates to where something ultimately serves
(for example, a user or publisher geo, a platform, an HTTPS vs HTTP request,
or the type of auction).

fields.name: disapprovalReasons
fields.desc:
Any disapprovals bound to this restriction.
Only present if status=DISAPPROVED.
Can be used to filter the response of the
creatives.list
method.

fields.name: contexts
fields.desc: The contexts for the restriction.

fields.name: status
fields.desc:
The status of the creative in this context (for example, it has been
explicitly disapproved or is pending review).

enum.name: STATUS_UNSPECIFIED
enum.desc: The status is not known.

enum.name: DISAPPROVAL
enum.desc: The ad was disapproved in this context.

enum.name: PENDING_REVIEW
enum.desc: The ad is pending review in this context.

schemas.name: AuctionContext
schemas.desc: @OutputOnly The auction type the restriction applies to.

fields.name: auctionTypes
fields.desc: The auction types this restriction applies to.

schemas.name: LocationContext
schemas.desc: @OutputOnly The Geo criteria the restriction applies to.

fields.name: geoCriteriaIds
fields.desc:
IDs representing the geo location for this context.
Please refer to the
[geo-table.csv](https://storage.googleapis.com/adx-rtb-dictionaries/geo-table.csv)
file for different geo criteria IDs.

schemas.name: Creative
schemas.desc: A creative and its classification data.

fields.name: detectedLanguages
fields.desc:
@OutputOnly
The detected languages for this creative. The order is arbitrary. The codes
are 2 or 5 characters and are documented at
https://developers.google.com/adwords/api/docs/appendix/languagecodes.

fields.name: creativeId
fields.desc:
The buyer-defined creative ID of this creative.
Can be used to filter the response of the
creatives.list
method.

fields.name: version
fields.desc: @OutputOnly The version of this creative.

fields.name: html
fields.desc: An HTML creative.

fields.name: dealsStatus
fields.desc:
@OutputOnly The top-level deals status of this creative.
If disapproved, an entry for 'auctionType=DIRECT_DEALS' (or 'ALL') in
serving_restrictions will also exist. Note
that this may be nuanced with other contextual restrictions, in which case,
it may be preferable to read from serving_restrictions directly.
Can be used to filter the response of the
creatives.list
method.

enum.name: STATUS_UNSPECIFIED
enum.desc: The status is unknown.

enum.name: NOT_CHECKED
enum.desc: The creative has not been checked.

enum.name: CONDITIONALLY_APPROVED
enum.desc:
The creative has been conditionally approved.
See serving_restrictions for details.

enum.name: APPROVED
enum.desc: The creative has been approved.

enum.name: DISAPPROVED
enum.desc: The creative has been disapproved.

fields.name: accountId
fields.desc:
The account that this creative belongs to.
Can be used to filter the response of the
creatives.list
method.

fields.name: native
fields.desc: A native creative.

fields.name: detectedSensitiveCategories
fields.desc:
@OutputOnly Detected sensitive categories, if any.
See the ad-sensitive-categories.txt file in the technical documentation for
a list of IDs. You should use these IDs along with the
excluded-sensitive-category field in the bid request to filter your bids.

fields.name: restrictedCategories
fields.desc: All restricted categories for the ads that may be shown from this creative.

fields.name: vendorIds
fields.desc:
All vendor IDs for the ads that may be shown from this creative.
See https://storage.googleapis.com/adx-rtb-dictionaries/vendors.txt
for possible values.

fields.name: detectedDomains
fields.desc:
@OutputOnly
The detected domains for this creative.

fields.name: detectedAdvertiserIds
fields.desc: @OutputOnly Detected advertiser IDs, if any.

fields.name: filteringStats
fields.desc: @OutputOnly The filtering stats for this creative.

fields.name: attributes
fields.desc:
All attributes for the ads that may be shown from this creative.
Can be used to filter the response of the
creatives.list
method.

fields.name: apiUpdateTime
fields.desc: @OutputOnly The last update timestamp of the creative via API.

fields.name: video
fields.desc: A video creative.

fields.name: adChoicesDestinationUrl
fields.desc: The link to AdChoices destination page.

fields.name: openAuctionStatus
fields.desc:
@OutputOnly The top-level open auction status of this creative.
If disapproved, an entry for 'auctionType = OPEN_AUCTION' (or 'ALL') in
serving_restrictions will also exist. Note
that this may be nuanced with other contextual restrictions, in which case,
it may be preferable to read from serving_restrictions directly.
Can be used to filter the response of the
creatives.list
method.

enum.name: STATUS_UNSPECIFIED
enum.desc: The status is unknown.

enum.name: NOT_CHECKED
enum.desc: The creative has not been checked.

enum.name: CONDITIONALLY_APPROVED
enum.desc:
The creative has been conditionally approved.
See serving_restrictions for details.

enum.name: APPROVED
enum.desc: The creative has been approved.

enum.name: DISAPPROVED
enum.desc: The creative has been disapproved.

fields.name: advertiserName
fields.desc: The name of the company being advertised in the creative.

fields.name: servingRestrictions
fields.desc:
@OutputOnly The granular status of this ad in specific contexts.
A context here relates to where something ultimately serves (for example,
a physical location, a platform, an HTTPS vs HTTP request, or the type
of auction).

fields.name: agencyId
fields.desc: The agency ID for this creative.

fields.name: clickThroughUrls
fields.desc: The set of destination URLs for the creative.

fields.name: corrections
fields.desc: @OutputOnly Shows any corrections that were applied to this creative.

fields.name: impressionTrackingUrls
fields.desc: The set of URLs to be called to record an impression.

fields.name: detectedProductCategories

schemas.name: WatchCreativeRequest
schemas.desc: A request for watching changes to creative Status.

fields.name: topic
fields.desc:
The Pub/Sub topic to publish notifications to.
This topic must already exist and must give permission to
ad-exchange-buyside-reports@google.com to write to the topic.
This should be the full resource name in
"projects/{project_id}/topics/{topic_id}" format.

schemas.name: HtmlContent
schemas.desc: HTML content for a creative.

fields.name: width
fields.desc: The width of the HTML snippet in pixels.

fields.name: snippet
fields.desc: The HTML snippet that displays the ad when inserted in the web page.

fields.name: height
fields.desc: The height of the HTML snippet in pixels.

fields.name: users
fields.desc: The returned list of client users.

fields.name: nextPageToken
fields.desc:
A token to retrieve the next page of results.
Pass this value in the
ListClientUsersRequest.pageToken
field in the subsequent call to the
clients.invitations.list
method to retrieve the next
page of results.

schemas.name: AppContext
schemas.desc: @OutputOnly The app type the restriction applies to for mobile device.

fields.name: appTypes
fields.desc: The app types this restriction applies to.

schemas.name: SecurityContext
schemas.desc: @OutputOnly A security context.

fields.name: securities
fields.desc: The security types in this context.

schemas.name: ClientUser
schemas.desc:
A client user is created under a client buyer and has restricted access to
the Ad Exchange Marketplace and certain other sections
of the Ad Exchange Buyer UI based on the role
granted to the associated client buyer.

The only way a new client user can be created is via accepting an
email invitation
(see the
accounts.clients.invitations.create
method).

All fields are required unless otherwise specified.

fields.name: email
fields.desc:
User's email address. The value of this field
is ignored in an update operation.

fields.name: clientAccountId
fields.desc:
Numerical account ID of the client buyer
with which the user is associated; the
buyer must be a client of the current sponsor buyer.
The value of this field is ignored in an update operation.

fields.name: status
fields.desc: The status of the client user.

enum.name: USER_STATUS_UNSPECIFIED
enum.desc: A placeholder for an undefined user status.

enum.name: PENDING
enum.desc: A user who was already created but hasn't accepted the invitation yet.

enum.name: ACTIVE
enum.desc: A user that is currently active.

enum.name: DISABLED
enum.desc: A user that is currently disabled.

fields.name: userId
fields.desc:
The unique numerical ID of the client user
that has accepted an invitation.
The value of this field is ignored in an update operation.

schemas.name: Disapproval
schemas.desc: @OutputOnly The reason and details for a disapproval.

fields.name: details
fields.desc: Additional details about the reason for disapproval.

fields.name: reason
fields.desc: The categorized reason for disapproval.

enum.name: LENGTH_OF_IMAGE_ANIMATION
enum.desc: The length of the image animation is longer than allowed.

enum.name: BROKEN_URL
enum.desc: The click through URL doesn't work properly.

enum.name: MEDIA_NOT_FUNCTIONAL
enum.desc: Something is wrong with the creative itself.

enum.name: INVALID_FOURTH_PARTY_CALL
enum.desc: The ad makes a fourth party call to an unapproved vendor.

enum.name: INCORRECT_REMARKETING_DECLARATION
enum.desc:
The ad targets consumers using remarketing lists and/or collects
data for subsequent use in retargeting, but does not correctly declare
that use.

enum.name: LANDING_PAGE_ERROR
enum.desc: Clicking on the ad leads to an error page.

enum.name: AD_SIZE_DOES_NOT_MATCH_AD_SLOT
enum.desc: The ad size when rendered does not match the declaration.

enum.name: NO_BORDER
enum.desc: Ads with a white background require a border, which was missing.

enum.name: FOURTH_PARTY_BROWSER_COOKIES
enum.desc:
The creative attempts to set cookies from a fourth party that is not
certified.

enum.name: LSO_OBJECTS
enum.desc: The creative sets an LSO object.

enum.name: BLANK_CREATIVE
enum.desc: The ad serves a blank.

enum.name: DESTINATION_URLS_UNDECLARED
enum.desc: The ad uses rotation, but not all destination URLs were declared.

enum.name: PROBLEM_WITH_CLICK_MACRO
enum.desc: There is a problem with the way the click macro is used.

enum.name: INCORRECT_AD_TECHNOLOGY_DECLARATION
enum.desc: The ad technology declaration is not accurate.

enum.name: INCORRECT_DESTINATION_URL_DECLARATION
enum.desc: The actual destination URL does not match the declared destination URL.

enum.name: EXPANDABLE_INCORRECT_DIRECTION
enum.desc: The declared expanding direction does not match the actual direction.

enum.name: EXPANDABLE_DIRECTION_NOT_SUPPORTED
enum.desc: The ad does not expand in a supported direction.

enum.name: EXPANDABLE_INVALID_VENDOR
enum.desc: The ad uses an expandable vendor that is not supported.

enum.name: EXPANDABLE_FUNCTIONALITY
enum.desc: There was an issue with the expandable ad.

enum.name: VIDEO_INVALID_VENDOR
enum.desc: The ad uses a video vendor that is not supported.

enum.name: VIDEO_UNSUPPORTED_LENGTH
enum.desc: The length of the video ad is not supported.

enum.name: VIDEO_UNSUPPORTED_FORMAT
enum.desc: The format of the video ad is not supported.

enum.name: VIDEO_FUNCTIONALITY
enum.desc: There was an issue with the video ad.

enum.name: LANDING_PAGE_DISABLED
enum.desc: The landing page does not conform to Ad Exchange policy.

enum.name: MALWARE_SUSPECTED
enum.desc: The ad or the landing page may contain malware.

enum.name: ADULT_IMAGE_OR_VIDEO
enum.desc: The ad contains adult images or video content.

enum.name: INACCURATE_AD_TEXT
enum.desc: The ad contains text that is unclear or inaccurate.

enum.name: COUNTERFEIT_DESIGNER_GOODS
enum.desc: The ad promotes counterfeit designer goods.

enum.name: POP_UP
enum.desc: The ad causes a popup window to appear.

enum.name: INVALID_RTB_PROTOCOL_USAGE
enum.desc: The creative does not follow policies set for the RTB protocol.

enum.name: RAW_IP_ADDRESS_IN_SNIPPET
enum.desc: The ad contains a URL that uses a numeric IP address for the domain.

enum.name: UNACCEPTABLE_CONTENT_SOFTWARE
enum.desc:
The ad or landing page contains unacceptable content because it initiated
a software or executable download.

enum.name: UNAUTHORIZED_COOKIE_ON_GOOGLE_DOMAIN
enum.desc: The ad set an unauthorized cookie on a Google domain.

enum.name: UNDECLARED_FLASH_OBJECTS
enum.desc: Flash content found when no flash was declared.

enum.name: INVALID_SSL_DECLARATION
enum.desc: SSL support declared but not working correctly.

enum.name: DIRECT_DOWNLOAD_IN_AD
enum.desc: Rich Media - Direct Download in Ad (ex. PDF download).

enum.name: MAXIMUM_DOWNLOAD_SIZE_EXCEEDED
enum.desc: Maximum download size exceeded.

enum.name: DESTINATION_URL_SITE_NOT_CRAWLABLE
enum.desc: Bad Destination URL: Site Not Crawlable.

enum.name: BAD_URL_LEGAL_DISAPPROVAL
enum.desc: Bad URL: Legal disapproval.

enum.name: PHARMA_GAMBLING_ALCOHOL_NOT_ALLOWED
enum.desc:
Pharmaceuticals, Gambling, Alcohol not allowed and at least one was
detected.

enum.name: DYNAMIC_DNS_AT_DESTINATION_URL
enum.desc: Dynamic DNS at Destination URL.

enum.name: POOR_IMAGE_OR_VIDEO_QUALITY
enum.desc: Poor Image / Video Quality.

enum.name: UNACCEPTABLE_IMAGE_CONTENT
enum.desc: For example, Image Trick to Click.

enum.name: INCORRECT_IMAGE_LAYOUT
enum.desc: Incorrect Image Layout.

enum.name: IRRELEVANT_IMAGE_OR_VIDEO
enum.desc: Irrelevant Image / Video.

enum.name: DESTINATION_SITE_DOES_NOT_ALLOW_GOING_BACK
enum.desc: Broken back button.

enum.name: MISLEADING_CLAIMS_IN_AD
enum.desc: Misleading/Inaccurate claims in ads.

enum.name: RESTRICTED_PRODUCTS
enum.desc: Restricted Products.

enum.name: UNACCEPTABLE_CONTENT
enum.desc: Unacceptable content. For example, malware.

enum.name: AUTOMATED_AD_CLICKING
enum.desc:
The ad automatically redirects to the destination site without a click,
or reports a click when none were made.

enum.name: INVALID_URL_PROTOCOL
enum.desc: The ad uses URL protocols that do not exist or are not allowed on AdX.

enum.name: UNDECLARED_RESTRICTED_CONTENT
enum.desc:
Restricted content (for example, alcohol) was found in the ad but not
declared.

enum.name: INVALID_REMARKETING_LIST_USAGE
enum.desc: Violation of the remarketing list policy.

enum.name: DESTINATION_SITE_NOT_CRAWLABLE_ROBOTS_TXT
enum.desc: The destination site's robot.txt file prevents it from being crawled.

enum.name: CLICK_TO_DOWNLOAD_NOT_AN_APP
enum.desc: Click to download must link to an app.

enum.name: INACCURATE_REVIEW_EXTENSION
enum.desc: A review extension must be an accurate review.

enum.name: SEXUALLY_EXPLICIT_CONTENT
enum.desc: Sexually explicit content.

enum.name: GAINING_AN_UNFAIR_ADVANTAGE
enum.desc: The ad tries to gain an unfair traffic advantage.

enum.name: GAMING_THE_GOOGLE_NETWORK
enum.desc: The ad tries to circumvent Google's advertising systems.

enum.name: DANGEROUS_PRODUCTS_KNIVES
enum.desc: The ad promotes dangerous knives.

enum.name: DANGEROUS_PRODUCTS_EXPLOSIVES
enum.desc: The ad promotes explosives.

enum.name: DANGEROUS_PRODUCTS_GUNS
enum.desc: The ad promotes guns & parts.

enum.name: DANGEROUS_PRODUCTS_DRUGS
enum.desc: The ad promotes recreational drugs/services & related equipment.

enum.name: DANGEROUS_PRODUCTS_TOBACCO
enum.desc: The ad promotes tobacco products/services & related equipment.

enum.name: DANGEROUS_PRODUCTS_WEAPONS
enum.desc: The ad promotes weapons.

enum.name: UNCLEAR_OR_IRRELEVANT_AD
enum.desc: The ad is unclear or irrelevant to the destination site.

enum.name: PROFESSIONAL_STANDARDS
enum.desc: The ad does not meet professional standards.

enum.name: DYSFUNCTIONAL_PROMOTION
enum.desc: The promotion is unnecessarily difficult to navigate.

enum.name: INVALID_INTEREST_BASED_AD
enum.desc: Violation of Google's policy for interest-based ads.

enum.name: MISUSE_OF_PERSONAL_INFORMATION
enum.desc: Misuse of personal information.

enum.name: OMISSION_OF_RELEVANT_INFORMATION
enum.desc: Omission of relevant information.

enum.name: UNAVAILABLE_PROMOTIONS
enum.desc: Unavailable promotions.

enum.name: MISLEADING_PROMOTIONS
enum.desc: Misleading or unrealistic promotions.

enum.name: INAPPROPRIATE_CONTENT
enum.desc: Offensive or inappropriate content.

enum.name: SENSITIVE_EVENTS
enum.desc: Capitalizing on sensitive events.

enum.name: SHOCKING_CONTENT
enum.desc: Shocking content.

enum.name: ENABLING_DISHONEST_BEHAVIOR
enum.desc: Products & Services that enable dishonest behavior.

enum.name: TECHNICAL_REQUIREMENTS
enum.desc: The ad does not meet technical requirements.

enum.name: RESTRICTED_POLITICAL_CONTENT
enum.desc: Restricted political content.

enum.name: UNSUPPORTED_CONTENT
enum.desc: Unsupported content.

enum.name: INVALID_BIDDING_METHOD
enum.desc: Invalid bidding method.

enum.name: VIDEO_TOO_LONG
enum.desc: Video length exceeds limits.

enum.name: VIOLATES_JAPANESE_PHARMACY_LAW
enum.desc: Unacceptable content: Japanese healthcare.

enum.name: UNACCREDITED_PET_PHARMACY
enum.desc: Online pharmacy ID required.

enum.name: ABORTION
enum.desc: Unacceptable content: Abortion.

enum.name: CONTRACEPTIVES
enum.desc: Unacceptable content: Birth control.

enum.name: NEED_CERTIFICATES_TO_ADVERTISE_IN_CHINA
enum.desc: Restricted in China.

enum.name: KCDSP_REGISTRATION
enum.desc: Unacceptable content: Korean healthcare.

enum.name: NOT_FAMILY_SAFE
enum.desc: Non-family safe or adult content.

enum.name: CLINICAL_TRIAL_RECRUITMENT
enum.desc: Clinical trial recruitment.

enum.name: MAXIMUM_NUMBER_OF_HTTP_CALLS_EXCEEDED
enum.desc: Maximum number of HTTP calls exceeded.

enum.name: MAXIMUM_NUMBER_OF_COOKIES_EXCEEDED
enum.desc: Maximum number of cookies exceeded.

enum.name: PERSONAL_LOANS
enum.desc: Financial service ad does not adhere to specifications.

enum.name: UNSUPPORTED_FLASH_CONTENT
enum.desc: Flash content was found in an unsupported context.

schemas.name: ListCreativesResponse
schemas.desc: A response for listing creatives.

fields.name: nextPageToken
fields.desc:
A token to retrieve the next page of results.
Pass this value in the
ListCreativesRequest.page_token
field in the subsequent call to `ListCreatives` method to retrieve the next
page of results.

fields.name: creatives
fields.desc: The list of creatives.

schemas.name: ServingContext
schemas.desc: The serving context for this restriction.

fields.name: location
fields.desc:
Matches impressions coming from users *or* publishers in a specific
location.

fields.name: auctionType
fields.desc: Matches impressions for a particular auction type.

fields.name: all
fields.desc: Matches all contexts.

enum.name: SIMPLE_CONTEXT
enum.desc: A simple context.

fields.name: appType
fields.desc: Matches impressions for a particular app type.

fields.name: securityType
fields.desc: Matches impressions for a particular security type.

fields.name: platform
fields.desc: Matches impressions coming from a particular platform.

schemas.name: Correction
schemas.desc: @OutputOnly Shows any corrections that were applied to this creative.

fields.name: details
fields.desc: Additional details about what was corrected.

fields.name: type
fields.desc: The type of correction that was applied to the creative.

enum.name: CORRECTION_TYPE_UNSPECIFIED
enum.desc: The correction type is unknown. Refer to the details for more information.

enum.name: VENDOR_IDS_ADDED
enum.desc:
The ad's declared vendors did not match the vendors that were detected.
The detected vendors were added.

enum.name: SSL_ATTRIBUTE_REMOVED
enum.desc:
The ad had the SSL attribute declared but was not SSL-compliant.
The SSL attribute was removed.

enum.name: FLASH_FREE_ATTRIBUTE_REMOVED
enum.desc:
The ad was declared as Flash-free but contained Flash, so the Flash-free
attribute was removed.

enum.name: FLASH_FREE_ATTRIBUTE_ADDED
enum.desc:
The ad was not declared as Flash-free but it did not reference any flash
content, so the Flash-free attribute was added.

enum.name: REQUIRED_ATTRIBUTE_ADDED
enum.desc:
The ad did not declare a required creative attribute.
The attribute was added.

enum.name: REQUIRED_VENDOR_ADDED
enum.desc:
The ad did not declare a required technology vendor.
The technology vendor was added.

enum.name: SSL_ATTRIBUTE_ADDED
enum.desc:
The ad did not declare the SSL attribute but was SSL-compliant, so the
SSL attribute was added.

enum.name: IN_BANNER_VIDEO_ATTRIBUTE_ADDED
enum.desc:
Properties consistent with In-banner video were found, so an
In-Banner Video attribute was added.

enum.name: MRAID_ATTRIBUTE_ADDED
enum.desc: The ad makes calls to the MRAID API so the MRAID attribute was added.

enum.name: FLASH_ATTRIBUTE_REMOVED
enum.desc:
The ad unnecessarily declared the Flash attribute, so the Flash attribute
was removed.

enum.name: VIDEO_IN_SNIPPET_ATTRIBUTE_ADDED
enum.desc: The ad contains video content.

fields.name: contexts
fields.desc: The contexts for the correction.

schemas.desc: A request for associating a deal and a creative.

fields.name: association
fields.desc: The association between a creative and a deal that should be added.

fields.name: dealsId

fields.name: creativeId

schemas.name: RemoveDealAssociationRequest

fields.name: association

schemas.name: StopWatchingCreativeRequest
schemas.desc: A request for stopping notifications for changes to creative Status.

A token to retrieve the next page of results.
Pass this value in the
ListClientsRequest.pageToken
field in the subsequent call to the
accounts.clients.list method
to retrieve the next page of results.

fields.name: clients
fields.desc: The returned list of clients.

schemas.name: VideoContent
schemas.desc: Video content for a creative.

fields.name: videoUrl
fields.desc: The URL to fetch a video ad.

A token to retrieve the next page of results.

ListClientUserInvitationsRequest.pageToken
field in the subsequent call to the
clients.invitations.list
method to retrieve the next
page of results.

schemas.desc: @OutputOnly The type of platform the restriction applies to.

pathParams.name: accountId
pathParams.desc:
Unique numerical account ID for the buyer of which the client buyer
is a customer; the sponsor buyer to create a client for. (required)

methods.name: get
methods.desc: Gets a client buyer with a given client account ID.

pathParams.name: accountId
pathParams.desc: Numerical account ID of the client's sponsor buyer. (required)

pathParams.name: clientAccountId
pathParams.desc: Numerical account ID of the client buyer to retrieve. (required)

methods.name: list
methods.desc: Lists all the clients for the current sponsor buyer.

pathParams.name: accountId
pathParams.desc: Unique numerical account ID of the sponsor buyer to list the clients for.

optinalQueryParams.name: pageSize
optinalQueryParams.desc:
Requested page size. The server may return fewer clients than requested.
If unspecified, the server will pick an appropriate default.

optinalQueryParams.name: pageToken
optinalQueryParams.desc:
A token identifying a page of results the server should return.
Typically, this is the value of
ListClientsResponse.nextPageToken
returned from the previous call to the
accounts.clients.list method.

pathParams.name: accountId
pathParams.desc:
Unique numerical account ID for the buyer of which the client buyer
is a customer; the sponsor buyer to update a client for. (required)

pathParams.name: clientAccountId
pathParams.desc: Unique numerical account ID of the client to update. (required)

pathParams.name: accountId
pathParams.desc: Numerical account ID of the client's sponsor buyer. (required)

pathParams.name: clientAccountId
pathParams.desc:
Numerical account ID of the client buyer
that the user to be retrieved is associated with. (required)

pathParams.name: userId
pathParams.desc: Numerical identifier of the user to retrieve. (required)

methods.name: update
methods.desc:
Updates an existing client user.
Only the user status can be changed on update.

pathParams.name: accountId
pathParams.desc: Numerical account ID of the client's sponsor buyer. (required)

pathParams.name: clientAccountId
pathParams.desc:
Numerical account ID of the client buyer that the user to be retrieved
is associated with. (required)

pathParams.name: userId
pathParams.desc: Numerical identifier of the user to retrieve. (required)

methods.name: list
methods.desc:
Lists all the known client users for a specified
sponsor buyer account ID.

pathParams.name: accountId
pathParams.desc:
Numerical account ID of the sponsor buyer of the client to list users for.
(required)

pathParams.name: clientAccountId
pathParams.desc:
The account ID of the client buyer to list users for. (required)
You must specify either a string representation of a
numerical account identifier or the `-` character
to list all the client users for all the clients
of a given sponsor buyer.

optinalQueryParams.name: pageToken
optinalQueryParams.desc:
A token identifying a page of results the server should return.
Typically, this is the value of
ListClientUsersResponse.nextPageToken
returned from the previous call to the
accounts.clients.users.list method.

optinalQueryParams.name: pageSize
optinalQueryParams.desc:
Requested page size. The server may return fewer clients than requested.
If unspecified, the server will pick an appropriate default.

methods.name: get
methods.desc: Retrieves an existing client user invitation.

pathParams.name: accountId
pathParams.desc: Numerical account ID of the client's sponsor buyer. (required)

pathParams.name: clientAccountId
pathParams.desc:
Numerical account ID of the client buyer that the user invitation
to be retrieved is associated with. (required)

pathParams.name: invitationId
pathParams.desc: Numerical identifier of the user invitation to retrieve. (required)

methods.name: list
methods.desc:
Lists all the client users invitations for a client
with a given account ID.

pathParams.name: accountId
pathParams.desc: Numerical account ID of the client's sponsor buyer. (required)

pathParams.name: clientAccountId
pathParams.desc:
Numerical account ID of the client buyer to list invitations for.
(required)
You must either specify a string representation of a
numerical account identifier or the `-` character
to list all the invitations for all the clients
of a given sponsor buyer.

optinalQueryParams.name: pageToken
optinalQueryParams.desc:
A token identifying a page of results the server should return.
Typically, this is the value of
ListClientUserInvitationsResponse.nextPageToken
returned from the previous call to the
clients.invitations.list
method.

optinalQueryParams.name: pageSize
optinalQueryParams.desc:
Requested page size. Server may return fewer clients than requested.
If unspecified, server will pick an appropriate default.

methods.name: create
methods.desc:
Creates and sends out an email invitation to access
an Ad Exchange client buyer account.

pathParams.name: accountId
pathParams.desc: Numerical account ID of the client's sponsor buyer. (required)

pathParams.name: clientAccountId
pathParams.desc:
Numerical account ID of the client buyer that the user
should be associated with. (required)

pathParams.name: accountId
pathParams.desc:
The account that this creative belongs to.
Can be used to filter the response of the
creatives.list
method.

pathParams.name: creativeId
pathParams.desc:
The buyer-defined creative ID of this creative.
Can be used to filter the response of the
creatives.list
method.

pathParams.name: accountId
pathParams.desc:
The account to list the creatives from.
Specify "-" to list all creatives the current user has access to.

optinalQueryParams.name: query
optinalQueryParams.desc:
An optional query string to filter creatives. If no filter is specified, all active creatives will be returned. Supported queries are:
  • accountId=account_id_string
  • creativeId=creative_id_string
  • dealsStatus: {approved, conditionally_approved, disapproved, not_checked}
  • openAuctionStatus: {approved, conditionally_approved, disapproved, not_checked}
  • attribute: {a numeric attribute from the list of attributes}
  • disapprovalReason: {a reason from DisapprovalReason
Example: 'accountId=12345 AND (dealsStatus:disapproved AND disapprovalReason:unacceptable_content) OR attribute:47'

optinalQueryParams.name: pageToken
optinalQueryParams.desc:
A token identifying a page of results the server should return.
Typically, this is the value of
ListCreativesResponse.next_page_token
returned from the previous call to 'ListCreatives' method.

optinalQueryParams.name: pageSize
optinalQueryParams.desc:
Requested page size. The server may return fewer creatives than requested
(due to timeout constraint) even if more are available via another call.
If unspecified, server will pick an appropriate default.
Acceptable values are 1 to 1000, inclusive.

pathParams.name: accountId
pathParams.desc:
The account that this creative belongs to.
Can be used to filter the response of the
creatives.list
method.

optinalQueryParams.name: duplicateIdMode
optinalQueryParams.desc:
Indicates if multiple creatives can share an ID or not. Default is
NO_DUPLICATES (one ID per creative).

methods.name: stopWatching
methods.desc:
Stops watching a creative. Will stop push notifications being sent to the
topics when the creative changes status.

pathParams.name: accountId
pathParams.desc: The account of the creative to stop notifications for.

pathParams.name: creativeId
pathParams.desc:
The creative ID of the creative to stop notifications for.
Specify "-" to specify stopping account level notifications.

pathParams.name: accountId
pathParams.desc: The account the creative belongs to.

pathParams.name: creativeId
pathParams.desc: The ID of the creative to retrieve.

methods.name: watch
methods.desc:
Watches a creative. Will result in push notifications being sent to the
topic when the creative changes status.

pathParams.name: accountId
pathParams.desc: The account of the creative to watch.

pathParams.name: creativeId
pathParams.desc:
The creative ID to watch for status changes.
Specify "-" to watch all creatives under the above account.
If both creative-level and account-level notifications are
sent, only a single notification will be sent to the
creative-level notification topic.

pathParams.name: accountId
pathParams.desc:
The account to list the associations from.
Specify "-" to list all creatives the current user has access to.

pathParams.name: creativeId
pathParams.desc:
The creative ID to list the associations from.
Specify "-" to list all creatives under the above account.

optinalQueryParams.name: pageToken
optinalQueryParams.desc:
A token identifying a page of results the server should return.
Typically, this is the value of
ListDealAssociationsResponse.next_page_token
returned from the previous call to 'ListDealAssociations' method.

optinalQueryParams.name: pageSize
optinalQueryParams.desc:
Requested page size. Server may return fewer associations than requested.
If unspecified, server will pick an appropriate default.

optinalQueryParams.name: query
optinalQueryParams.desc:
An optional query string to filter deal associations. If no filter is specified, all associations will be returned. Supported queries are:
  • accountId=account_id_string
  • creativeId=creative_id_string
  • dealsId=deals_id_string
  • dealsStatus:{approved, conditionally_approved, disapproved, not_checked}
  • openAuctionStatus:{approved, conditionally_approved, disapproved, not_checked}
Example: 'dealsId=12345 AND dealsStatus:disapproved'

methods.name: add
methods.desc: Associate an existing deal with a creative.

pathParams.name: accountId
pathParams.desc: The account the creative belongs to.

pathParams.name: creativeId
pathParams.desc: The ID of the creative associated with the deal.

methods.name: remove
methods.desc: Remove the association between a deal and a creative.

pathParams.name: accountId
pathParams.desc: The account the creative belongs to.

pathParams.name: creativeId
pathParams.desc: The ID of the creative associated with the deal.
